summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, disclosing Brady material consisting of interview notes and FBI 302s from two interviews with an unnamed individual conducted during the investigation. The letter designates the contents as confidential under the protective order.

events.title: Government Brady Disclosure to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends a letter to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel disclosing interview notes and FBI 302s from two interviews with an individual as potential Brady material.

events.title: Interview of Unnamed Individual
events.description: The government conducted an interview (referenced by date on the document) with an unnamed individual during its investigation into the charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East Tenth Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office disclosed Brady material to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team on September 14, 2020.
The disclosed material includes notes and FBI 302s from two interviews with an unnamed individual conducted during the investigation.
The government explicitly states this disclosure does not constitute an admission that the information is exculpatory.
All disclosed materials are designated as 'Confidential' under the case's protective order.
The document references an interview date of June 20, 2018, indicating investigative activity prior to Maxwell's 2020 indictment.
